title: Chicken Marsala Recipe
description: Chicken Marsala is an Italian-style dish of tender pan-fried chicken breasts in a sweet Marsala wine and mushroom sauce.

Italian-Style Chicken Chicken Marsala 4.6 (5,997) 4,232 Reviews 574 Photos Chicken Marsala is an Italian-style recipe for tender pan-fried chicken breasts in a sweet Marsala wine and mushroom sauce. It's super quick and easy to make for a weeknight dinner and sophisticated enough for company. By Allrecipes Member Updated on May 22, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 574 574 574 574 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Chicken Marsala is a classic dish loaded with rich, meaty, and herbaceous flavor. A luscious mushroom wine sauce coats fried chicken breast for an unrivaled taste of Italian-inspired goodness. This mouthwatering recipe transforms common pantry ingredients into a show-stopping meal. Learn how to make the best Chicken Marsala right here. What Is Chicken Marsala? Chicken Marsala is a succulent dish that features thinly sliced pieces of pan-fried chicken breast and mushrooms in a reduced wine sauce. Its name comes from the fortified Italian wine used to give the dish its trademark deep, nutty, and slightly sweet flavor. How to Make Chicken Marsala Make a restaurant-quality chicken dish at home in just 30 minutes. You'll find the full recipe below with step-by-step instructions, but here's what you can expect when you make this top-rated recipe: Begin by coating chicken in a seasoned flour mixture. Cook chicken breast in a large skillet over medium heat until lightly brown. Add mushrooms, wine, and sherry to the mix before covering the skillet and simmering for around 10 minutes. What to Serve With Chicken Marsala This family-friendly chicken recipe pairs well with many side dishes. Try a cheesy risotto or Tuscan white beans for a full Italian meal, or opt for classic dinner rolls. Any way you serve it, this decadent Chicken Marsala is sure to be a hit. Can You Freeze Chicken Marsala? If you want to enjoy your delicious leftovers later, pour Chicken Marsala in a freezer pan and save for up to two months. Thaw in the refrigerator, and reheat in an oven preheated to 350 degrees F for best results. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "This recipe is quick and easy to make," shares home cook Craig. "I added sliced onions and halved plum tomatoes. Served over a bed of white rice. Delicious." "Our new go-to meal!" raves reviewer Kelley. "We could not find Marsala wine so substituted port wine instead - delish! Plus, I added way more mushrooms!" "I removed the chicken from the pan while making the sauce and added a little half and half to it to make it creamy," says Jillian. "It turned out great - this is a definite keeper!" Editorial contributions by Rai Mincey Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ¼ cup all-purpose flour for coating ½ teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper ½ teaspoon dried oregano 4 medium skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded 1/4 inch thick 4 tablespoons butter 4 tablespoons olive oil 1 cup sliced mushrooms ½ cup Marsala wine ¼ cup cooking sherry Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios In a shallow dish or bowl, mix together the flour, salt, pepper and oregano. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Coat chicken pieces in flour mixture. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios In a large skillet, melt butter in olive oil over medium heat. Place chicken in the pan, and lightly brown. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Turn over chicken pieces, and add mushrooms. Pour in wine and sherry. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover skillet; simmer chicken 10 minutes, turning once, until no longer pink and juices run clear. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS I Made It Print 9,196 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Chicken Marsala 01 of 574 Photo by  Will Dickey / Food Styling: Sally McKay / Prop styling: Phoebe Hauser 02 of 574 Photo by  OrangePear3831 03/08/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Very easy recipe, the only adjustment I made was also seasoning the chicken with; salt,pepper, Italian seasoning and garlic powder. This was ready quick and tasted delicious. 03 of 574 Photo by  Jon-Paul Ward 02/18/2024 I didn’t have the sherry so I doubled up on the Marsala. It’s was awesome! 04 of 574 Photo by  Ukulelegal 02/07/2024 Great recipe my entire family loves it. I added onion and it was delicious 05 of 574 Photo by  VividLadle6746 01/24/2024 it was great 06 of 574 Photo by  EagerSoup8974 01/12/2024 Great!! 07 of 574 Photo by  JumpyCake6944 07/13/2023 Pretty easy and oh so good! Served with White Cannelloni Beans and wilted field greens. 08 of 574 Photo by  SassyBagel7997 02/25/2023 I have been making this recipe for years, takes about an hour from start to finish, cheap easy marsala recipe 09 of 574 Photo by  GentleStir3058 02/01/2023 So, I was looking for a good recipe for Chicken Marsala and as my go to site I came to AllRecipes for just that. Before I cook anything as I’m sure some of you do as well, I like to read the reviews to see what the end results are for any tips. I found that a few people used cornstarch to thicken the sauce and also used seasoned bread crumbs in the flour to coat the chicken which I found both recommendations to work out amazingly well!! I added extra Marsala to strengthen the flavor and doubled all the other sauce ingredients so I had some leftover. With all that being said, this recipe is now my new go to!!🤤🤤 I’ve only ever had Chicken Marsala 1 other time and it was at this restaurant me and my girlfriend went to. I was not to impressed with the meal which completely turned me off of even wanting to try it again. However, I was in Walmart doing some food shopping the other day getting some cooking wines and decided maybe I should try cooking the dish myself. Well, turns out I actually like it!! Hope y’all found my post helpful.😁 Have a blessed day! 10 of 574 Photo by  paula tillett 01/26/2023 It was so easy and sooo delicious! This will definitely be on our menu from now on. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Easy Chicken Saltimbocca 101 Ratings Easier Chicken Marsala 845 Ratings Quick Chicken Piccata 1,760 Ratings Garlic Wine Chicken 69 Ratings Chicken Marsala Florentine 522 Ratings Chicken Marsala II 203 Ratings Creamy Chicken Marsala 93 Ratings Easy Tomato Chicken Marsala 18 Ratings Chicken Valdostano 162 Ratings Saltimbocca di Pollo alla Romana (Prosciutto-Stuffed Chicken Breast Roulades) 16 Ratings Chicken with Chanterelle Mushrooms and Marsala Wine 13 Ratings Instant Pot® Chicken Marsala 6 Ratings Chicken Milanese 86 Ratings Coq au Vin alla Italiana 257 Ratings Easy Paleo Chicken Marsala 6 Ratings Amazing Italian Lemon Butter Chicken 679 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
